ipl::CComplexImage Class Reference

CComplexImage is a class derived from CGenericImage consisting of pixels with type FLOAT32 (both a real an imaginar part), last updated 7/21/2002. More...

#include <ipl98/cpp/complex_image.h>

streaming operators

Detailed Description

CComplexImage is a class derived from CGenericImage consisting of pixels with type FLOAT32 (both a real an imaginar part), last updated 7/21/2002.

Saving and loading images of this type has not yet been fully tested and documentation for the file format still need to be written. Though it should be possible to save and load and all bug reports are welcome!

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

See also:
CGenericImage
Version:
0.95, by ivb@mip.sdu.dk and edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
Ivar Balslev and René Dencker Eriksen

Definition at line 57 of file complex_image.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ipl::CComplexImage::CComplexImage (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
FLOAT32    ReAndIm = 0
) 
 

Constructor for empty image, allocates memory.

ROI is inactivated. All pixel values are initialised to 0.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels.
Height  The height of image in pixels.
ReAndIm  Initial value at all positions in both real and imaginary part. Defaults to 0. The function is faster when ReAndIm initializes to 0.

ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:

bool ipl::CComplexImage::Add (  CComplexImage &    Addend ) 
 

Calculates the sum of two CComplexImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Addend  is the image of class CComplexImage to be added
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty

Definition at line 625 of file complex_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetTComplexImagePtr(), m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CComplexImage::Alloc (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
FLOAT32    ReAndIm = 0
) 
 

Allocates memory for image with given size.

All pixel values are initialised to 0. Sets Origin to "RAM", origo to (0,0) and size of border to 0. ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels
Height  The height of image in pixels
ReAndIm  Initial value at all positions in both real and imaginary part. Defaults to 0. The function is faster when ReAndIm initializes to 0.
Returns :
False, if allocation failed.
See also:
AllocFast

Allocates memory for image with given size.

bool ipl::CComplexImage::CCFactorAndMultiply (  CComplexImage &    Factor ) 
 

Calculates product of two images.

The image Factor is complex conjugated before multiplication. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Factor  is the image of class CComplexImage to be complex conjugated and multiplied
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or if they have different dimensions

bool ipl::CComplexImage::CopyDisplace (  int    dx,
int    dy
) 
 

Performs a displacement so that (dx,dy) in the old picture becomes (0,0).

Periodic continuation is assumed. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
dx  is the horizontal displacement
dy  is the vertical displacement
Returns :
False if the image is empty

bool ipl::CComplexImage::CopySubImage (  CComplexImage &    SourceImage,
int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax
) 
 

Copies SourceImage of type CComplexImage to this image.

The values xmin, ymin, xmax and ymax) specifies the rectangle to be copied, uses integers because of origo offset. ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:
xmin  defines left side of rectangle in source image to copy from
ymin  defines top side of rectangle in source image to copy from
xmax  defines right side of rectangle in source image to copy from
ymax  defines buttom side of rectangle in source image to copy from
Returns :
false if outside image

Definition at line 356 of file complex_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), TComplexImage::FileInfo, GetConstTComplexImagePtr(), m_History, m_Image, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, TFileInfo::PathAndFileName, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CComplexImage::CutOrZeroPad (  CComplexImage &    Source ) 
 

Copies a source image into 'this' object without scaling.

If the width/height of the source is larger than that of 'this' object, zero padding is applied. Simple cuts are applied for reduced width/height. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Source  is the source image
Returns :
False if 'this' image and/or the source image are empty

const TComplexImage * ipl::CComplexImage::GetConstTComplexImagePtr (    )  const
 

Returns the pointer to the TComplexImage structure.

To use the kernel C functions it is sometimes necessary to pass the TComplexImage structure. In other cases do not use this function to manipulate the image but use the methods in this class!

Returns :
pointer to a TComplexImage structure.

TComplexImage * ipl::CComplexImage::GetTComplexImagePtr (    ) 
 

Returns the pointer to the TComplexImage structure.

To use the kernel C functions it is sometimes necessary to pass the TComplexImage structure which contents will be changed. In other cases do not use this function to manipulate the image but use the methods in this class!

Returns :
pointer to a TComplexImage structure.

Definition at line 683 of file complex_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetTComplexImagePtr(), m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

CComplexImage & ipl::CComplexImage::operator= (  const CComplexImage &    SourceImage ) 
 

Overloading of assignment operator.

All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, palette, ROI and history. Previous data in this object are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty. The operator is fastest if this object has same dimensions as SourceImage! In that case no reallocation of destination image is needed. Adds new line to history. An error is produced if both sides of the assignment operator is the same object.

Definition at line 54 of file complex_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetConstTComplexImagePtr(), ipl::CText::GetItem(), GetOrigin(), TComplexImage::History, m_History, m_Image, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROILowerRight, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIUpperLeft, TString::pChars, ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine(), ipl::CText::SetTextPtr(), and ipl::CText::TotalItems().

)  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets Region Of Interest (ROI) for this object.

If outside image dimensions false is returned and an error is produced. In that case the state of ROI is left unchanged. Image dimensions are the values returned from the methods GetMinX(), GetMaxX(), GetMinY() and GetMaxY(), i.e. it includes origo offset.

Parameters:
UL  Upper left value of ROI, relative to origo.
LR  Lower right value of ROI, relative to origo.
Returns :
False, if values are outside image dimensions, relative to origo.

Implements ipl::CGenericImage.

bool ipl::CComplexImage::Subtract (  CComplexImage &    Subtrahend ) 
 

Subtract calculates the difference of two CComplexImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Subtrahend  is the image of class CComplexImage to be subtracted
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty
